intro: Melicope dubia, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a small evergreen tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has rough, fissured bark and produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
